metadata.title: CVE-2023-23602 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
A mishandled security check when creating a WebSocket in a WebWorker causedthe Content Security Policy connect-src header to be ignored. This couldlead to connections to restricted origins from inside WebWorkers. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 109, Thunderbird < 102.7, and Firefox ESR <102.7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23602` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1').
